newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Waigel says ready to find stability pact solution.
newsitem.headline: Waigel says ready to find stability pact solution.

text.p: German Finance Minister Theo Waigel said on Thursday he was ready to find a good solution to an EU dispute over the precise terms of a pact to enforce fiscal discipline after the launch of a single currency.

'In any case we are prepared to look for a good solution. But it must be appropriate to the subject,' he told reporters at a special session of EU finance ministers in Dublin. He also said he hoped a decision would reached.
Luxembourg's Prime Minister Jean-Claude Juncker told reporters, 'We need a deal between a rigid mechanism and not an overly rigid mechanism.'
The finance ministers are meeting to try to thrash out a deal on the stability pact ahead of a two-day summit of EU heads of government.

Germany is pressing for a strict definition of the circumstances in which countries running a fiscal deficit above three percent should be exempt from fines. Other countries want more flexibility in deciding when a country should be left off the hook.
